definitions.text: the officer below the master on a commercial ship
a fellow member of a team
examples: it was his first start against his former teammates

definitions.text: the partner of an animal (especially a sexual partner)
examples: he loved the mare and all her mates
when a match is found an entry is made in the notebook
he lost the mate to his shoe
one eye was blue but its fellow was brown

definitions.text: South American holly; leaves used in making a drink like tea
informal term for a friend of the same sex
South American tea-like drink made from leaves of a South American holly called mate
a chess move constituting an inescapable and indefensible attack on the opponent's king
bring two objects, ideas, or people together
examples: This fact is coupled to the other one
Matchmaker, can you match my daughter with a nice young man?
The student was paired with a partner for collaboration on the project

definitions.text: place an opponent's king under an attack from which it cannot escape and thus ending the game
examples: Kasparov checkmated his opponent after only a few moves
